abstract: The Dow Jones industrial average was down in early trading after the nation’s top mortgage lender sought to shore up its cash position and a report showed that construction of new homes fell in July.
snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average was down in early trading after the nation’s top mortgage lender sought to shore up its cash position and a report showed that construction of new homes fell in July.
lead_paragraph: Stocks opened sharply lower on Wall Street today after a sell-off in Asia and heavy losses in Europe, the latest reverberations of the credit crunch stemming from the reversals in the American mortgage market.

headline.main: U.S. Stocks Open Lower After Major Asian Sell-Off

byline.original: By Vikas Bajaj and Wayne Arnold
